meanings.definition: The SI unit of luminous intensity, equal to the intensity of a light source emitting light in a given direction with a frequency of 540 terahertz and a radiant intensity of 1/683 watt per steradian.

A unit of luminous intensity used in photometry, equal to the luminous intensity in a given direction of a source that emits monochromatic radiation of frequency 540 x 10^12 hertz and that has a radiant intensity in that direction of 1/683 watt per steradian.
